w:r.w:t: AI Self and Peer Evaluation System
AI Self and Peer Evaluation System

Current self- and peer-assessment methods lack fairness, consistency, and effective summarization of student feedback. Many digital tools simply collect responses without ensuring their quality or reducing subjectivity.
The project will develop an AI-powered system that:
Guides students in giving constructive peer feedback.
Uses NLP to analyze, classify, and summarize comments.
Provides sentiment and usefulness analysis to reduce bias.
Integrates Google APIs for scalability and ease of use.
Ensures transparency, fairness, and privacy compliance.
Clear, constructive, and fair peer feedback; less overload from long or repetitive comments.
Automated insights and reduced grading time through summarized reports.
A transparent, scalable, and innovative system that strengthens academic integrity.
Description of the Problem or Gap

Manual peer evaluations are inconsistent and time-consuming, and digital platforms without AI still rely on human judgment. Students may provide unhelpful comments, and teachers struggle to validate large volumes of data.
Collects responses but lacks AI processing.
Provides rubrics but not AI-driven summarization.
Improves feedback quality but does not manage comment overload.
Classifies comments but does not summarize or rank them.

The system will fill these gaps by integrating AI for classification, summarization, and fairness analysis with Google API-based scalability. This ensures evaluations are consistent, fair, and meaningful.
Improve the fairness and consistency of student peer evaluations by
after deployment by implementing a structured peer evaluation system with standardized rubrics, required rating fields, and automatic scoring rules.
in feedback clarity and usefulness by generating automated AI-powered summaries and categorized insights within three months of system launch.
Increase clarity and usefulness of evaluation results for
by providing AI-enhanced dashboards with real-time analytics and visual reports within the first semester of use.
with the Philippine Data Privacy Act and achieve secure access for all users through Google OAuth2 authentication and encrypted data handling before the system’s initial deployment
Rating scores based on rubric criteria
Validate required fields and prevent incomplete submissions
Enforce standardized rubrics across all evaluations
Store evaluation records in the database
Allow teachers to view, filter, and download evaluations
User-friendly interface for mobile and desktop
Data privacy compliance with the Philippine Data Privacy Act
All comments submitted by peers for a single student.
Redundancy detection to reduce repetitive feedback
Summaries written in clear, readable language
No raw data exposed to unauthorized users
AI results, evaluation scores, and system analytics
Role-based views for students and teachers
Full compliance with the Philippine Data Privacy Act
Summarization and sentiment analysis of comments.
Initial deployment limited to pilot institutions.
AI accuracy will improve with larger datasets over time.
A web-based platform where students conduct self- and peer-evaluations, and teachers access summarized reports. AI modules analyze comments, while Google APIs handles authentication and integration.
Google APIs for login, storage, and deployment.
Agile methodology with iterative sprints, pilot testing, and user-driven refinements.
Target Users, Customers, Beneficiaries, and Partners
Schools and universities adopting AI-enhanced evaluation.
Web browsers and mobile devices for access.
Deployment on Google Cloud for scalability.
≥30% improvement in evaluation fairness and consistency.
A/B testing (AI-supported vs. traditional peer evaluation).
Kulkarni, C., Khosravi, H., & Gehringer, E. (2024).
: Using AI to support students’ feedback provision in peer assessment for writing. Computers & Education.
Louie, J. (2025). The good, bad, and ugly of comment prompts: Effects on length and helpfulness of peer feedback. International Journal of Educational Technology in Higher Education.
Ma, Y., Yuan, Y., & Liu, S. (2022).
: Automated characterization of peer review comments across courses. Proceedings of the 53rd ACM Technical Symposium on Computer Science Education, 350–358.
Nazir, S., & Hussain, A. (2021). Sentiment analysis of students’ feedback with NLP and deep learning: A systematic mapping study. Applied Sciences, 11(9), 3986.

Cheng, L., & Wu, H. (2020). The development of an online peer assessment tool using Google applications. Proceedings of the 28th ACM Conference on User Modeling, Adaptation and Personalization, 274–283.

Topping, K., Gehringer, E., Khosravi, H., Gudipati, R., & Jadhav, S. (2025). Enhancing peer assessment with artificial intelligence. International Journal of Educational Technology in Higher Education, 22(1), 1–25.
